Pre-reqs

Three things are necessary to complete this form: your suit measurements, dress shirt measurements, and an email address that reports can be sent reports to. That's it.

Measurements for sportcoats, sweaters, pants, casual shirts, whatever, will be extrapolated from suit and dress shirt measurements that you provide.

You will have the opportunity to review and fine tune those extrapolations, but they're generated for your convenience.

Let's get started.

Base Measurements

Please give your measurements for suits and dress shirts. These measurements form your "base" that all other measurements can be inferred from.

Clothing Category
Measurement item
Measurement value (in)
Tolerance (in)
Extrapolated Measurements

The measurements filled here can be automatically filled in based on measurements entered previously in the "Base Measurements" fields. Click the 'Extrapolate' button to do so.

Fields that have already been filled in will not be overwritten.
Clothing Category
Measurement item
Measurement value (in)
Tolerance (in)
Review and Submit

It's time to review. Here is a summary of what we've gathered so far.

You want to see suit listings where the jacket...

chest (armpit to armpit, taken flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and the shoulders measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the jacket waist (measured flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the sleeve (from shoulder seam to cuff) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the length (back of collar to hem) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the pants for that suit have...

a waist (measured flat) that measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER and

and where the hips (measured flat) measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the inseam measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the rise measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the cuff width (measured flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

You want to see listings for sportcoats where the...

chest (armpit to armpit, taken flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and the shoulders measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the jacket waist (measured flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the sleeve (from shoulder seam to cuff) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the length (back of collar to hem) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

Any listings for coats and jackets (overcoats to leather jackets) should have...

chest (armpit to armpit, taken flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and the shoulders measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the sleeve (from shoulder seam to cuff) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

For dress shirts, the the listings should fit like...

chest (armpit to armpit, taken flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and the shoulders measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the sleeve (from shoulder seam to cuff) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

And for casual shirts, we have...

chest (armpit to armpit, taken flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and the shoulders measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the sleeve (from shoulder seam to cuff) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

Similar to suit pants, the listings for pant separates should fit like...

a waist (measured flat) that measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the hips (measured flat) measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the inseam measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the rise measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the cuff width (measured flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

Finally, the measurements for sweaters should match...

chest (armpit to armpit, taken flat) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and the shoulders measure from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER

and where the sleeve (from shoulder seam to cuff) measures from $START_PLACEHOLDER to $START_PLACEHOLDER
